intro: Lightfootia annua, commonly known as the annual lightfootia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous annual, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, attracting various pollinators.
